Thanks! Would that account for the tapping noise?

  ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
  From: Rj 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, May 26,=
 2009 4:07 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question





        Yes=
.  Also faulty wiring, which is even more dangerous.
        Also with flak=
ey transformers or other power distribution in the area, or power lines.
  =
      Perhaps you can check with some neighbors, and see how their power is=
 doing.


        --- On Tue, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombie=
ghostresearch.com> wrote:


          From: April Abercrombie <april@abercr=
ombieghostresearch.com>
          Subject: [EVP-ITC] Electrical Question
  =
        To: "EVP-ITC Group" <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
          Date: Tuesd=
ay, May 26, 2009, 2:52 PM



          Hi All,

          Is there someone =
here that can answer and electrical question for me?

          During the =
case that I recorded those possible EVP's-there was a loud tapping noise th=
at seemed to come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checking my logs, every time o=
ne of  these clicks were heard, there would be an EMF spike in the livingro=
om. The 2nd bedroom is upstairs, the livingroom downstairs. The home owners=
 have also reported that they have a touch lamp that comes on all the time =
by itself and the lights in the Kitchen will dim occasionally.

          N=
ow these taps are not consistent in timing, loudness or rhythm. Could this =
be the work of faulty breakers?

          Thanks!
          April
